definition: of noble character and unquestionable integrity (idiom)
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
bright/clear/resonant/to shine/to show/to reveal
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: His noble character and sterling integrity are admired by people.
sentences.chinese: 他的高风亮节为人仰慕。

sentences.english: Such as if have no you, your concession, I bathe small talk favorably your lofty and conscientious symbol.
sentences.chinese: 如若没有你，你退让，我沐小小赞扬你高风亮节。

sentences.english: Bamboo do their talents at the same time, it reflects the light of humanity's own sharp sense of integrity.
sentences.chinese: 竹尽其才的同时，也折射出自身高风亮节的人性光芒。

sentences.english: It always cherishes the love for human's noble character and sterling integrity.
sentences.chinese: 始终揣怀着对人类高风亮节的爱。

definition: moral integrity/unflinching righteousness
selfless/impartial
noble and clean-living/lofty and unsullied
not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
to have a high notion of one's duty/to be highly principled
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
upright and plainspoken
not to submit to force
strength of character/vigorous style (of calligraphy)
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous/openhearted/unselfish/magnanimous/broad-minded
to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life/would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles
open and candid (idiom); straightforward and upright
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
for the common good and forgetting personal interests (idiom); to behave altruistically/selfless
